intro: Quiina colonensis, commonly known as the Colombian quina, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
